info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SOCORRO COUNTY THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 215 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Magdalena, or 25 miles northwest of Socorro, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Socorro County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
